meanings.definition: To have messed up or ruined something.
meanings.sent1: I fugged up the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: She fugged her chances of winning by not studying for the test.
meanings.sent3: The magician fugged his trick and made the rabbit disappear for real!
meanings.sent4: The storm fugged the peaceful garden into a chaotic mess of fallen branches.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter fugged the elegant dinner party by spilling soup on the host's lap.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of confusion or disarray.
meanings.sent1: After the earthquake, everything in the house was fugged up.
meanings.sent2: The new student was fugged about where his next class was.
meanings.sent3: The cat fugged up the room by knocking over all the plants.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was fugged with worry about the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam fugged the streets with honking cars and frustrated drivers.
